# Build an App 

## App architecture

The app will contain 3 main components. A native header, a tab bar, and the Webviews.

![](data:image/png;base64,)

### Header

The header must be native and it should include the logo logo.png attached with this document. The logo should be centered horizontally.

### Tab Bar

The tab bar must be native and needs to have 4 tabs. Home, Shop, Account and Bag. Each tab must point to a different url and when clicked it should display the content of that url.

These are the urls that the tab items should point to:

Home: [https://www.thebay.com/](https://www.thebay.com/)

Shop: [https://www.thebay.com/c/men](https://www.thebay.com/c/men)

Account: [https://www.thebay.com/account/login](https://www.thebay.com/account/login)

Bag: [https://www.thebay.com/cart](https://www.thebay.com/cart)

WebViews

The webviews will load web content based on the tab item selected.

## Loading spinner

It is important that when navigating through web pages within a Webview, there is an indication of the web pages loading. To do that, add a loading spinner animation in the middle of the content while the web pages are being loaded.

Example: (The spinner spins in a circle)

![](data:image/png;base64,)

## Logo goes Home

If the logo on the header is tapped, the app should navigate to the Home tab and load its default url.

## JS injection: burger menu in header

Add a burger icon on the left side of the header. When users tap this icon, it should toggle the website’s burger menu.

Hint: You need to simulate a click on the website’s burger menu when tapping the burger icon in the native header. (Using Javascript injection in the Webview)

The html selectors of the website’s burger menu is: button.navbar-toggler

## CSS Modifications

It is important for us to be able to make some css modifications in case the website we’re loading is not very mobile friendly. In this case, the most obvious change we need to make is to hide the website’s header because we have our own native header.

Please hide the header of the homepage in the Home tab only.

Hint: Using the Webview native component you need to inject a javascript script that will generate CSS code that will hide the header of the webpage.

This is the CSS rule you need to inject into your webview: header { display: none !important;}
